head.title: email : Webview : RPS Direct - Tuesday, April 14, 2020

meta.content: COVID-19 Update www.rvaschools.net Tuesday, April 14, 2020 Dear #RPSStrong Family, I'd like to start by welcoming anyone who's receiving my RPS Direct message for the first time today! This afternoon, we added several thousand email addresses to make sure we're connecting with as wide a segment of the RPS Family as possible. If you'd prefer not to receive these messages, no problem at all. Just click the Opt out link at the bottom of the email. But I hope you'll stay! Today's updates: Access for MS Students to HS Modules on RPS@Home – Edgenuity is working as fast as they can to make these modules available to our middle school students. Everything should be ready no later than Friday. Thank you for your patience! Computer Distribution – Enormous gratitude to everyone who helped distribute computers today to our high school seniors! Starting on Friday, we'll begin handing out devices to our 9th-11th graders (and any seniors who couldn't make it today). I'll have all the details in tomorrow's RPS Direct. After we get through HS students, we'll move on to MS and ES students. If you need a computer or internet access and you haven't signed up yet, please do
meta.name: description

meta.content: COVID-19 Update www.rvaschools.net Tuesday, April 14, 2020 Dear #RPSStrong Family, I'd like to start by welcoming anyone who's receiving my RPS Direct message for the first time today! This afternoon, we added several thousand email addresses to make sure we're connecting with as wide a segment of the RPS Family as possible. If you'd prefer not to receive these messages, no problem at all. Just click the Opt out link at the bottom of the email. But I hope you'll stay! Today's updates: Access for MS Students to HS Modules on RPS@Home – Edgenuity is working as fast as they can to make these modules available to our middle school students. Everything should be ready no later than Friday. Thank you for your patience! Computer Distribution – Enormous gratitude to everyone who helped distribute computers today to our high school seniors! Starting on Friday, we'll begin handing out devices to our 9th-11th graders (and any seniors who couldn't make it today). I'll have all the details in tomorrow's RPS Direct. After we get through HS students, we'll move on to MS and ES students. If you need a computer or internet access and you haven't signed up yet, please do

div.span: I'd like to start by welcoming anyone who's receiving my RPS Direct message for the first time today! This afternoon, we added several thousand email addresses to make sure we're connecting with as wide a segment of the RPS Family as possible. If you'd prefer not to receive these messages, no problem at all. Just click the "Opt out" link at the bottom of the email. But I hope you'll stay!

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

strong.span: Access for MS Students to HS Modules on RPS@Home

div.span: – Edgenuity is working as fast as they can to make these modules available to our middle school students. Everything should be ready no later than Friday. Thank you for your patience!

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: – Enormous gratitude to everyone who helped distribute computers today to our high school seniors! Starting on Friday, we'll begin handing out devices to our 9th-11th graders (and any seniors who couldn't make it today). I'll have all the details in tomorrow's RPS Direct. After we get through HS students, we'll move on to MS and ES students.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: If you need a computer or internet access and you haven't signed up yet, please do so here right away. If you already signed up, you're all set! Just keep an eye out for the distribution schedule and pick-up details in my daily RPS Direct.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.span: As I shared yesterday, please see below for some exciting exceptional education updates.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: The EdPlan Connect Parent Portal has launched! This portal will allow parents/caregivers to review and sign Individualized Education Programs (IEPs) as well as eligibility documentation. It will automatically generate a message to the email address on record every time there's a new document that requires your review and signature. You can also log in at any time to review your child's documents. To learn more about the portal, click here.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Tutoring is now available for students with IEPs. To register, click here.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.span: Please visit the exceptional education section of RPS@Home to learn about other supports!

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: As always, if you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact me at jkamras@rvaschools.net.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
div.span: Please keep sending them to me at jkamras@rvaschools.net!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to shoutout my daughter's teacher, Mr. Gaskin. He’s a 3 grade teacher at Holton. He is delivering a chapter book with snacks to all his students. It was a pleasant surprise seeing him today. My daughter was excited to see her teacher and receive her package. I would like to add he has not stopped teaching his class. He’s continued communicating and educating the ENTIRE time kids have been home from school. I’m beyond impressed and thankful for his passion.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Shout out to Rachel Campbell at Reid ES, who got workbooks for all her students to work on with her daily, listens to students read to her on the phone, and has Zoom meetings with her second graders!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I want to take this opportunity to shout the RPS LIEP Team! I am part of an amazing team under Tyra Harrison’s leadership. Jennifer Blackwell, Liliana Melendez, Shannon Hall, Raquel Vandenesse, Tori Pierson, Andria Impson, Lariza Gregory, and Kaitlin Mendez, Muchísimas Gracias for your hard work and dedication. Your passion for our students shows in everything you do! Thanks to you, RPS@Home en Español is now live!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I work at Broad Rock Elementary full-time now. I was a substitute teacher at all the schools. I was broken when I came to Broad Rock, but Mrs. Green just took me in. I know that she is a good principal because she helps you to grow. I just wanted to give a shout out to a great lady, mentor, and leader.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: A big shout out goes to the fabulous Boushall Middle School Exceptional Education Department, especially ReNe Pierce, Evelyn Baylor-Holmes, Whitney Gillespie, Shelita Turner, Taneisha Pryor, Susan Husky, and Myquel Mclane, for ensuring IEP and eligibility meetings have been held virtually and have been inclusive of all team members. They are dedicated to their students, families, and RPS, and are much appreciated!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Shout out to Mrs. Bonnie Holland, exceptional education teacher at Henderson Middle School. Mrs. Holland has been working closely with students and families to provide virtual access to 8th grade review information. Mrs. Holland recently set up student support information using the "NearPod" online student engagement platform! Students can now access review information through the use of smartphones, tablets, and computers...Great job adjusting to distance learning, Mrs. Holland!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I would like to give a big shout-out to Monique Harris, School Counselor at Huguenot High School. Mrs. Harris reached out to me to make sure my 9th grader was able to access Clever and Edgenuity. She also assisted with enrolling my daughter in her required classes and she responds to my emails promptly. Her assistance and willingness to help made the process so much easier! Thank you, RPS Family, for all you do!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: I just wanted to send a shout out to Ms. Tammy Smith and Ms. Jessica Williams at J.B. Fisher for their awesome, fun video lessons! My daughter has really been missing her classmates, and it's been so fun for her to have this hour each day to learn with her teachers and classmates.

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Ms. Kimbrough, one of my son's teachers, is doing a great job reaching out to parents personally and keeping us informed!

li.style: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
li.em: Clary Carleton has been a huge help to our family as we navigate this time. She’s been gracious and responsive to not only the big questions and concerns, but also the seemingly superfluous questions, too. It gives me great comfort to know if I have a question I don't need to perseverate on it alone.

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255)

span.span: – Today's celebrity reader is James Lane, the Virginia State Superintendent of Education. Thank you, Dr. Lane, for taking the time to do this! And thank you for leadership and support throughout this pandemic. We're so grateful to have you at the helm.

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255)

span.span: To see all the other celebrity readers, just click here.

span.style: vertical-align: baseline; font-size: 13px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif
span.span: "Mr. K's 30 Minutes of Math!"– Check out my math lessons at 2 pm every weekdays. I'm focusing on fractions, but every lesson also includes a Math Joke of the Day and a Math Riddle of the Day. You can also view past episodes here!

div.style: display: block;margin-bottom: 10px;font-size: 12px;font-weight: normal;line-height: 1.5;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333;font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size: 13px;color: #333
